key_insight: StereoPilot replaces the brittle multi‑stage Depth–Warp–Inpaint (DWI) pipeline with a unified, efficient model that uses learned generative priors to directly convert monocular video into stereo pairs, reducing error propagation and handling different stereo formats in one pass.
problem_solved: Automates high‑quality monocular→stereo conversion by addressing DWI shortcomings: cascading errors across stages, depth ambiguity in single views, occlusion/inpainting failures, and inconsistency between parallel and converged stereo formats.
method: End-to-end stereo conversion model that conditions monocular input on pretrained generative priors to guide view synthesis and plausible occlusion filling.
Joint depth-aware representation and cross-view consistency losses to resolve depth ambiguity and enforce coherent stereo geometry for both parallel and converged formats.
Efficient architecture and format-aware warping/conditioning that collapse multiple DWI stages into a single unified pipeline, reducing error accumulation and inference overhead.
impact: Provides a practical, robust tool for scaling 3D content creation — lowering cost and complexity for VR/AR, 3D cinema, and stereo datasets while simplifying integration for ML practitioners and production pipelines.
visual_elements: Side-by-side pipeline diagram: traditional DWI (Depth → Warp → Inpaint) vs StereoPilot (single unified model with generative prior).
Architecture sketch: monocular input → generative prior conditioning → joint depth & stereo output, with loss icons for cross-view consistency and occlusion handling.
Before/after examples: monocular frame, DWI result (artifacts), StereoPilot result (consistent stereo pair) with disparity maps.
Small infographic showing compatibility with parallel and converged stereo formats (two camera geometry icons and an arrow to unified output).
paper_title: StereoPilot: Learning Unified and Efficient Stereo Conversion via Generative Priors
paper_authors: Guibao Shen, Yihua Du, Wenhang Ge, Jing He, Chirui Chang
